# NuggyNet
### A web browser developed by AWETheBird only because he was bored.

# This is read-only now. Go to the [NEW REPO](https://www.github.com/NuggyNet/NuggyNet) for updates.

~AWETheBrowser~ / ~NuggetWeb~ / NuggyNet is based off the PyQt5 framework. Sadly, PyQtWebEngine is based off Chromium, but sometime I will try to make my own web engine titled "WebNoctis"!

Below, you can see a picture of NuggyNet v1.4. I'm too lazy to update the image so here's a picture of NuggetWeb v1.4

![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/78144805/335588422-d33716c1-7fc2-498f-af8f-ffc58dcf9f81.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..Q1QPDP3I5-HDk8J2oMScQaCMzSWEMPhIav5Nn5Rugl8)

### Features planned for future releases
- [ ] WebNoctis engine (might never be made)
- [ ] New status bar
   * Loading speed progress bar
   * Page title (because how else do we show it when there aren't going to be any tabs)
   * Final loading speed shown in milliseconds
- [ ] 56k dial-up internet simulation
- [ ] An options menu (I tried to implement one but it caused crashes)
- [ ] Working video playback (Hey, at least YouTube Music works!)
- [ ] DevTools [F12] (y'know, like Inspect Element)
- [ ] Dual monitor mode (Main window will be restricted to monitor 1 and a QWidget will be opened in full screen on Monitor 2, still haven't planned anything to do with it)

# Feel free to contribute. Anyways, check the [releases tab](https://github.com/Kirb101/NuggetWeb/releases/) please!
